meanings.definition: Used to express mild surprise or regret.
meanings.sent2: Whoops, I forgot to bring my umbrella.
meanings.sent3: Whoops, I accidentally wore mismatched socks today.
meanings.sent4: Whoops, I almost spilled my drink all over the table.
meanings.sent5: Whoops, I tripped over the curb and almost fell.

meanings.sent1: I made a whoops on my math test and got a lower grade.
meanings.sent2: She realized her whoops in the report after it was already submitted.
meanings.sent3: The cake turned out to be a delicious whoops with too much sugar.
meanings.sent4: His whoops in the presentation cost the company a big client.
meanings.sent5: The whoops in the recipe made the dish taste completely different.
